alert.note: Alert for Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 4:21PM CDT until June 02 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Lynn County in northwestern Texas... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 421 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across moving towards the warned area. Rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This area received extremely heavy rainfall yesterday and some areas remain flooded. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tahoka, O`Donnell, Grassland and Wilson. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
